meanings.definition: To interrupt a conversation with a comment or remark.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, Sarah couldn't help but interject with her thoughts on the new project.
meanings.sent2: Please do not interject while others are speaking; it's impolite.
meanings.sent3: John tried to interject a joke into the serious discussion, causing everyone to chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter interjected into the room, breaking the tension instantly.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise from outside interjected into our peaceful conversation.

meanings.definition: To insert a remark or comment into a conversation.
meanings.sent1: I wanted to interject a quick thank you before we moved on to the next topic.
meanings.sent2: Feel free to interject if you have any questions during the presentation.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to interject its opinion on the matter by meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: His sudden interjection of a personal story added depth to the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected interjection of humor made the meeting more enjoyable.
